tr.td:
Patient model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

a.title: An identifier of the patient that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National ID (birth number) or National patient identifier for the Czech patient. Multiple identifiers could be provided.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

a.title: Name associated with the patient/subject. Name might consist of name parts, e.g. Given name or names, family name/surname, name prefix etc.

a.title: The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of the test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.

a.title: This field must contain a recognized valid value for "administrative gender". If different, "physiological gender" should be communicated elsewhere.

tr.td:
C.1.4 - Administrative gender
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 Administrative Gender

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck10.png)

a.title: Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, ZIP code, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.

tr.td:
C.1.7 - Marital status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 marital-status

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck10.png)

C.1.8 - Citizenship (nationality)
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): ISO 3166-1-2

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck00.png)

a.title: The language which can be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

tr.td:
C.1.9 - Communcation language
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): BCP 47

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: C.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient/subject information

definition.value: C.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient/subject information
An identifier of the patient that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National ID (birth number) or National patient identifier for the Czech patient. Multiple identifiers could be provided.
Name associated with the patient/subject. Name might consist of name parts, e.g. Given name or names, family name/surname, name prefix etc.
The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of the test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.
This field must contain a recognized valid value for "administrative gender". If different, "physiological gender" should be communicated elsewhere.

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, ZIP code, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated to a person. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
Marital (civil) status of a patient
Citizenship/nationality of the patient.
The language which can be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.
C.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient/subject information
An identifier of the patient that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National ID (birth number) or National patient identifier for the Czech patient. Multiple identifiers could be provided.
Name associated with the patient/subject. Name might consist of name parts, e.g. Given name or names, family name/surname, name prefix etc.
The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of the test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.
This field must contain a recognized valid value for "administrative gender". If different, "physiological gender" should be communicated elsewhere.

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, ZIP code, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated to a person. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
Marital (civil) status of a patient
Citizenship/nationality of the patient.
The language which can be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.
